results.abstract: Russian cosmonaut Aleksandr Lazutkin, visiting New York City, comments on problems that plagued Mir space station while he was aboard during last year's 128-day crisis marathon aboard Mir; he is in New York to appear on QVC cable network, which is selling three Russian space suits for $25,000 apiece to help cash-poor Russian space program; photo (S)
results.snippet: Spin control means one thing in outer space and something completely different on earth. Having demonstrated his mastery of the first kind during last year's 128-day crisis marathon aboard the Mir space station, the cosmonaut ALEKSANDR LAZUTKIN...
results.lead_paragraph: Spin control means one thing in outer space and something completely different on earth. Having demonstrated his mastery of the first kind during last year's 128-day crisis marathon aboard the Mir space station, the cosmonaut ALEKSANDR LAZUTKIN demonstrated his skill at the second kind yesterday. Sitting in a cocktail lounge above Times Square, he played down the Mir's many problems, one of which was a pair of backup oxygen canisters that caught fire. Once the flames were out, ''my first reaction was to open the door and let it air out,'' he said. ''Then it sank in, you can't do that, it's not like a fire at home.''
